## Short bio

I hold a permanent position at Scientific Computing Program [PROCC](http://www.procc.fiocruz.br), [Fiocruz](https://portal.fiocruz.br/en), Rio de Janeiro, Brazil since December 2012. I hold a productivity fellowship from CNPq (bolsa de produtividade) and a Our State Young Cientist fellowship from FAPERJ (Jovem cientista Nosso Estado). I consider myself an applied Bayesian (bio)statistician. I am an elected member of [ISI](https://www.isi-web.org/) and a registered statistician at the Brazilian Statistical Council [CONRE2](http://www.conre2.org.br/). I spent some time (2019-2020) in London working on infectious disease modelling at the [CMMID](https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/research/centres/centre-mathematical-modelling-infectious-diseases)/[LSHTM](https://www.lshtm.ac.uk/), UK. My main research interests are on developing Bayesian statistical solutions/models to applied real problems, usually research questions related to infectious diseases epidemiology.
